reviews.text: It is an interesting young cathedral dedicated by Pope John Paul II. I have seen nicer cathedrals and Basilicas but it is right across the Royal Palace and easy to go to so I would at least take 30 min. to go inside and form your own opinion. I liked the different stained glass the most, followed by the interesting door where you can recognize the Pope himself.

Piece of architectural art created as place of worship. This unbelievable place gives sense of quietness and spirituality. Enormous inner space of the cathedral plays incredible harmony with minimalistic religious decorations. Main gate to the cathedral is truly unique piece of art.

Beautiful cathedral in Madrid located opposite the Palace and a short walk from Plaza Mayor. The cathedrals interior is spectacular and very acoustically laid out, the organ is amazing. Well worth a visit when in Madrid.

The most wonderful views from Madrid and the Royal Palace! The Cathedral itself is beautiful and huge, full of details. But when you go up to the building, it's amazing! To find the entrance, go to the very end of the square in front of the Palace. The visit finish inside the church. You won't regret it!

For claiming to be the most spectacular cathedral in Spain, I'm sorely disappointed. The inside was underwhelming and very strange. The stain glass and paintings were more modern, almost Picasso like. Also, it smelled terrible. Not like an old church, but more like sewage. I personally thought it was much better from the outside.

The Prado Museum is the beauty of history. The building itself is already inspiring for beauty. It's a shame only that the central entrance is closed. And the main box office and entrance are located from the side.
Truly masterpieces are presented there, the Spaniards in it are presented in all their glory. Velazquez, Goya.
Special attention deserves Bosch Hall. At one time, the Spanish King Philip II loved this artist. And thanks to him, you can now enjoy his most famous paintings in one place.
It is difficult to describe in words, you need to walk in the museum, look and study. And it definitely will take more than one day.

One of the best gallery in Madrid. You can find a lot of  famous paintings there. Entrance is for free just  two hours before closing. The line is very big but so fast. Highly recommended place. Its one of the must visit place in Madrid. Very cool and so atmospheric!

One of the finest museums in the world. I loved seeing all the artworks. I went there with my sister and we enjoyed seeing everything they had. They also have lots of pretty sculptures. If you're in Spain you must see this place it's gorgeous. And in front of the museum they usually have artist selling original paintings. Which you're nice to look at 2 also. I recommend this place to anyone.

Beautiful Museum with some of the most important and most famous painting and statues in the world. One of my favourite museums in the world without a doubt. The entrance is a little bit pricey but worth it and if you don't want to pay or can't pay that amount of money, you can always go after 18:00 when the entrance is free. Super recommended it!

Decent museum but felt a little over priced. They don't let you take pictures inside and have security everywhere to make sure no one does. It's got cool sculptures and paintings most of which are Jesus carrying the cross or getting crucified along with naked babies who my wife says were Cupid's. Which is cool, but still naked babies everywhere.

I really enjoyed my experience here. They are very friendly here and allow you to photograph everything which I love. They have a temporary exhibition here until June 2019 where there are many religious Christian artworks by some of the top masters including Rubens and Caravaggio. My favorite are Rubens paintings. Some of these paintings give you tingles of energy and beauty watching them. The first floor and a part of the second have modern art and the higher floors have the classical and Baroque paintings and some sculptures as I have seen what I believe is a Rodin there. Highly recommend this place.

A wonderful place with various collections. You can easily spend 3 hours there. You can find both temporary and permanent collections. The museum is very modern in its design and brightly colored. Very good location as well (easily accessible). If you're a teacher, the entrance is free.

Kind of a mind boggling experience. So much from so many periods. I even just ran through most of the top floor because I've seen so many Christ's on the cross and Mary's that I can't absorb any more. Even if you just focus on the bottom 2 floors and any temporary exhibit, you will feel satisfied and overwhelmed with art.

4.5 stars. A great alternative to El Prado although it stands alone on it's own merit. Overall, a wonderful exhibit. Extensive collections of art spanning almost a millennia which includes works from several masters. Well organized with appropriate lighting. I would recommend going in the late afternoon for a less crowded experience. Definitely with a visit for at least 3 hours or more.

If you like art go and see the museum that is in the shadow of great Prado. I think it's very important to visit this museum and compare it with famous neighbour museum. Give it a try when you enjoy art.
Hermoso lugar para visitar en familia y de paseo. Es un lugar histórico.

reviews.author_name: Centro de Terapias de Alternativa Paz

reviews.text: Wow! I don't understand how this museum doesn't have a perfect rating.  Truly astounding for a small, free museum.
Very interesting place! Clear explanation with english translation
Fascinating museum hidden away. Explores history of Madrid prior to its becoming the capital city. We'll presented and free.
An excellent, friendly free museum describing early local history, starting from the prehistoric times
A nice small museum close to the city centre. It has lots of local Roman artefacts and some cool Dino bones!!! Free entrance.

this is definitely a museum to visit I loved every artwork in here and this gentleman galdiano he's been a collector of various works of art on oil paintings things out there Leonardo DaVinci Francisco Goya and a whole bunch of different other things but what is noticeable about the artworks did he did collect was that they were all top-notch Best of the Best of the most beautiful things it is definitely wonderful to see something a reflection of a person's dreams and travels and ideas and fusion of beauty at collected in one place and then turn into a museum with his home being visited by so many people lovers of history and people being taught this information not stop because of this definitely worth a visit

Oh my good its fantastic, amazing, its just how could I express my feelings. I'm very excited to be there with all this incredible people enjoing so much I cant tell all the ways haha, Its too much!!!!

reviews.author_name: The Other Side of the Coin
reviews.text: Fantastic little museum with a collection of art and artefacts covering jewellery, painting, sculpture, cloth, table wares and more. Roughly arranged by periods or origins, with occasional contemporary pieces thrown in, which really highlight how bad contemporary art is. Just joking. Kind of. It’s free in the last hour, and the building itself is amazing. Well worth the visit.

Great museum for those interested in various types of art, architecture, history. Under visited but extremely important historical landmark in Madrid. We spent 2 hrs there looking at 4 floors of this collection within this mansion.
Awesome building. Well preserved and the collection is cool too
Beautiful collection of clothes,  taking you from the earliest tailoring designs to the modern current ones. Worth to be visited!
An intresting museum showing clothes going back from the XVII century. Also, Very intresting historical references to clothing habits of the Spanish.

what an amazing experience. Both men and women, young and old, will enjoy this Museum! The exhibits change, and are absolutely fascinating. You are allowed to take photos, just no flash Photography. They also have very helpful sheets in each room or hallway that explains the time periods and clothing featured. Everything is kept in impeccable condition. It is really a must-see.
Though the exhibition is interesting, the horrible smell of fried food (from museum’s cafe) dominates the entire floor...

The contents of the collection are varied and encompass up to or over 5 centuries of clothing! That part was amazing, the not so amazing part is the information cards on the items displayed, very little information is provided on any given piece, such as name of that piece: blouse, skirt, shirt, etc. and year. o and the internal accounting-inventory number of the item why???? I would much rather know the if that given piece belonged to a king, queen, infanta, and such. Tha same effort that was given to the pieces at the very entrance of the museum in the permanent collection should be given to all pieces, at the entrance there is a collection of pieces made for a TV serie dating back to 1900-1920 ish, and they have all kinds of info on this, that was great, but why did they cut back so drastically on the rest? Perhaps there is a list that may include contact info on people that donated most of the pieces in the museum back in 1925 for that exposition that led way to this museum, more investigative work has to be done.

I'm enjoying my time in the museum of Real Academia de Bellas Artes. Different artworks from classical up to modern. Masterpieces, beautiful paintings, unforgettable sculptures, building and city projects and more more more.  3 floors, please note that without elevator. 8 EUR entrance fee. Highly recommended.

We went on a wednesday when entry is free (check website for details) but would have been well worth the entry on any day. A really good selection of exhibits covering a wide range of periods and types.  Best to allow 3 hrs plus to do it justice.

A delightful second-string very central gallery, you will almost certainly have most of it to yourself! Some nice pieces, the Goya's are definitely the finest things there, and they are really wonderful. I liked the Sorollas, (one of my heroes, and not as well known internationally as he deserves, do go to his house and gallery in Madrid) and a bunch of lovely portraits by someone I have forgotten, but really lovely. Some patchy modern art on the top floor. Worth going, just don't expect the range of masterpieces of the Prado and Thyssen.
There are many good artworks. Worthy of visiting several times.
Very nice place. Great art. Compact.
Best planetarium I have ever visited
It's a nice place to get to know more about space and cosmos. It has an amazing astrophotographies

Rated 4 stars for the nostalgia from coming here as a kid, its a small museum, yes, is it old, perhaps, but the efforts into revamping it don't go unnoticed, hoping they reopen the mars exhibition soon and give props to my man Elon.
The display shows in the planetarium's dome never cease to amaze me and its 3D rendidition of the universe blew my mind.
As a final suggestion, I read in the end credits Neil degrasse Tyson was the narrator for the original, what a waste of talent it was to translate him.
Planetariums manager, put some captions and let his soothing voice do the rest ;)
Terrific

It's an okay place if you like planets and cosmology but to be honest, they need to revamp the entire place. Everything is old and belongs to the 90s. The planetarium itself is ok but the quality is low. I have been to the planetarium in Washington DC and this place cannot even begin to compete with that one. Also, it's a bit far from the metro stops. As a space fan, I'm happy I went there but don't think I'll go back again.

Highly recommendable, one of the most interactive science and technology museums I have ever been.  Lots of exhibits where children and adults alike can touch and feel how physics principles work.  Free entrance.  Scheduled workshops require a fee but are enjoyable mostly for the little ones. The attachment is a video with a demo wheee cosmic particles hitting a gas are shown!
Decent museum. Not as many exhibits as I thought there would be.

Awesome place, for kids and adults alike. Lot of interesting items and experiments on display. All the labels and descriptions are Spanish. You'll need about an hour to cover the two floors. Entry is free to both these floors. If you speak Spanish, I highly recommend the planetarium on third floor (for EUR 3). There is also a picnic section on ground floor for kids and families to enjoy their meals.

I must visit! Such a wonderfully interactive museum which helps kids and adults see concepts in an easier way. There are cool workshops and the planetarium offering many shows. Love it! There is a 'vending machine in a room to eat picnics.

Great museum with plenty of interesting hands-on experiments for kids and adults. Sessions for kids are great too. The only thing missing is a real cafeteria, there is only a picnick  room with vending machines and a microwave. Overall great experience, will come back for sure. Before the visit check the times of presentations and kids workshops. They are worth it and cost little (3 eur). General entrance is free.

Free entrance.
In the beggining it was looking very poorly, but after passing the doors there were hundreds of minerals on 3floors.
Some of them historical with parts of animals. Some simply beautiful.
Nothing in English but still very enjoyable.
Building from the inside is beautiful. Roof and some of the windows are astounding.

If you like minerals and ancients fossils that is definitely your museum.
Mainly focused on minerals, there are plenty of them on different sizes and shapes. 
The fossils are mostly prehistoric invertebrates  and flora.
The most of them are in glass cabinets and the bigger ones exposed open where you can touch them.

The kids that are studying minerals or like them will have a great time here.

As extra, the historic building deserves by itself a visit, that was designed as headquarters for Geological and Mining Institute of Spain.

The magnificent open main hall with its three stories is great. You can access each of the floors by various metallic and narrow spiral staircases that carries along to the beginning of the 20th century.
In the ground floor the showcases and glass cabinets set up hallways where you can get lost gazing at them.
Magnificent place! Beautiful setting. Historic, impressive facilities with an amazing, well-organized exposition of rocks and minerals.
Comprehensive interesting exhibits. Includes thoughtful use of Braille labelling. Architecture and stained glass windows amazing. Requires more than one visit.
One of my new favourite places in Madrid. The space is beautiful and the geological collections are something to behold.

If you love classic music and culture is a great place too keep an eye on. Every week there are concerts and activities, most of them free also. Recently they opened also a beautiful garden where you can enjoy nature and books from their library.
An ocean of calm - this little know foundation has a beautiful garden to sit and relax in, fantastic expos and a very old school café in the basement. Worth a visit!
A great place, a gem for culture, music, art and much more.
They have amazing concerts!

Their expositions, concerts, silent movies, conferences, library with very special books, magazines and catalogues and website which has every information and material of their art and culture events, from text to audios and videos, are amazing. And of course, the small coffee shop where you can see the concert on live TV. Also, their pamphlets and catalogues are so well-made. This place is absolutely one of my favorite art&culture spaces in Spain. I love it here and highly recommend it!

Finally got to come here! It’s only open on the weekends so it’s less busy than other parks but very beautiful!! Don’t bring food because it’s not allowed (there are lockers and staff to watch if you do). It would definitely be even more beautiful later in the spring with flowers are in bloom
Very nice garden specially during early spring days. I visited the other day for the first time and I liked it very much. Fortunately, it is not very well known by tourists so it is not crowded.
Interesting decorations and nice gardens. A place to relax and spend a good weekend afternoon.
Small but nice park. A bit far away from the center but accessible by metro green line.

Un sitio super bonito! Perfecto para pasar un tiempo andando al final de día con las últimas horas del sol. 

An incredibly beautiful place! Perfect for passing some time wandering around at the end of the day with the last hours of the sun.
Cute and free venue, however right now there are no roses yet.

Nice place with lots and lots of different types of roses. I was very impressed with all the different colours, shapes and sizes of all those roses from so many different countries.
Best time to go: April /May, if possible avoiding weekends. Entrance is FREE! (Not bad at all, I would say!)
Since this rose "garden" is literally next to the teleférico, it's nice to combine both attractions!
very relaxing park with variety of flowers. There is a public toilet as well.
Free rose garden with beautiful flowers. Extremely peaceful. Great for a date or to spend some alone time.
Beautiful flowers and close to the cable car, teleferico.

Really fun zoo! Layout is easy to figure out and walk, and animals are housed so that it is easy for people to visit and actually sight an animal. They have a large variety of animal shows, and the Dolphin one is the best I have ever seen. My negative is that I wish more things were printed in English but otherwise it was a great zoo.

Fantastic zoo that has animals I’ve never seen before(pandas, anteater, various bears) 
Nice layout easy to find your way around. Very family friendly. Great day out for young and old

A wonderful zoo with a huge variety of animals. The walkways were so wide, there was no problem going on a Saturday, it didn't feel crowded at all. Skip the food, bring your own. The aquarium is a bit tight to navigate, but the display is worth the visit

I'm not a huge fan of zoo's. But coming here was a breath of fresh air for me, all of the enclosures had plenty of room for the animals to move about and be comfortable, everything was well kept as well as some blind spots so that the animals could have their privacy if they wanted.

There's also easy access toilets for everyone and 3-4 cafes for you to take a break and let the kids chill out for 5 minutes and get some snacks.

The aquarium is just as good as the rest of the park as well as the dolphin showcase that happens 2-3 times a day and lasts 30-40 mins if you catch the right showing.

Over all brilliant place to go whether as a family or just with friends.

What I liked during my visit:
- the location is great, it is a very beautiful walk from the metro station to the zoo itself. The park around the area is a great place to enjoy the sun 
- the zoo was a lot of fun, especially considering how much space the animals have compared to other zoos 
- the aquarium was great, but a little small

What a disliked during my visit :
- the entrance was very expensive 
- the aquarium extremely small, the zoo altogether can be seen in 3 hours or less

We used to always get our baguettes from here. Unfortunately the quality has dropped recently. On two separate occasions we were handed day old baguettes and only realized this after we reached home..

Better to stay with frozen baguettes from Whole Foods that you can pop in the oven.. the quality is reliable.. and they come out hot and fresh..

If you love classic music and culture is a great place too keep an eye on. Every week there are concerts and activities, most of them free also. Recently they opened also a beautiful garden where you can enjoy nature and books from their library.
An ocean of calm - this little know foundation has a beautiful garden to sit and relax in, fantastic expos and a very old school café in the basement. Worth a visit!
A great place, a gem for culture, music, art and much more.
They have amazing concerts!

Their expositions, concerts, silent movies, conferences, library with very special books, magazines and catalogues and website which has every information and material of their art and culture events, from text to audios and videos, are amazing. And of course, the small coffee shop where you can see the concert on live TV. Also, their pamphlets and catalogues are so well-made. This place is absolutely one of my favorite art&culture spaces in Spain. I love it here and highly recommend it!

Go now. In 5 years time these places will be gone. I like sweetbreads and other bits of offal, and there's big flavours on offer here, but even the locals aren't sure what the menu translates as ... So ask the old boy serving to give you a glass of red, a tomato salad and a dish or two of whatever is on today and you'll enjoy a slice of old Madrid. Delicious

Excellent choice!! Tasty and yummy dishes, coming with explanation from the waiter. He was kind to combine a sample plate for us! (we've got to try 3 different types in one plate, although those 3 types were quite similar since they have names for different parts of the same "viscera").

Must say that you should like intestines and lamb before coming over!  

The crunchy version was our favorite: canutos.  

Expect very local environment (from 50 years ago, so don't be too picky!), really well manteined (clean and nice) for the number years it has existed. 

One sample plate and a small bottle of wine for two, 11 euros. Not bad.  

Great experience for a 1st timer. 
Visitors to Madrid should try if they are adventurous and want to taste something really local. Not many places are specialized on Entresijos and Gallinejas. 

Enjoy!!!
Delicious taditional food from Madrid. Really awesome
Great food!!!

We had a delightful dinner and plan to return during this and future visits to Madrid.  It is a small restaurant, and it was my impression that our waiter also did the cooking and served as the sommelier, all of which he did to our satisfaction. Their website includes a download describing, en español, the important and colorful history of Gallinejas, which has nothing to do with chickens, as the dictionary definition would imply, followed by specific descriptions of the various plates on their menu.  Again, all en español pero vale la pena a leer.
Very good bar/restaurant, perfect to hang out with friend, Wednesdays and Sundays have 1 euro menu. Their bocadillos are small but you can eat many different ones with a drink. I really like it.
Great tapas and inexpensive! Most items on the menu will cost 1-2 euros. The quality of course is not the best but for the price you can't beat it. A must do while visiting Madrid!

The person who made my order didn't even ask m if I want something to drink just told me how much I had to pay. Them the chips were inside the sandwich they just threw it to the plate without any care. But the final and best part!! The glass I was drinking had lipstick on it!! A total disaster.
Perfect place to have a beer and enjoy some drinking snack (small sandwich, fried, wings etc). Very cheap price. The only thing need to improve is there's no music.
Perfect place to grab a bite and some drinks. I loved their sandwiches and the concept. Great value for reasonable prices. You shouldn't miss this place when you're around.
We had gin ^ tonic and vodka. A place to have a few cocktails, good service
Super cosy and great food!
Good was very good, however we were not allow to take the bigger table in spite of the place being completely empty for most of the evening.
Simple but great food. The services wasn't the best when I went there, but it's wasn't enough for them to loose any stars. Highly recommended!

Came here on a Friday night and we were lucky to get a table. We had four delicious tapas dishes which all arrived at different times (which was nice as it gave a relaxed feel). There was an interesting craft beer selection too - the La Virgen Beer was particularly a favourite. The mixed croquettes were also delicious and worth a try!

Really nice place. Very traditional Spanish food. We ordered  two menus of the day  and it was enough for three persons. Good service. The food was really good (very homemade style) and reasonable prices.
Amazing food, very vibrant place with a lot of locals. Service was very efficient. If you are looking for mouthwatering food and not a fancy surrounding, this is the place! Great local beer as well

This review is for address number7, there is a lot of meat in the various BBQ meat plate, please try min. with 4 p the 25 euro also includes salad or fries which is big plus. Service are good and friendly. The glass of sangria is big than most of the restaurant and taste good for me. Will recommend this place.

After a waiting time of 15 minutes we were seated downstairs and got served immediately. The Alhambra beer was delicious, the food (as can be seen from the video) was more than enough for three people and also very tasty. 
I passed this place a couple more times and it is always this crowded, so factor in 15min waiting for your visit. 

Funny and attentive staff, good food and great beer!
Very good value for money. Alhambra won't disappoint. Very friendly staff, good food and normal prices!

It's a Nicholson's pub, quite easy to miss (you need to duck under an archway with a doorway somewhat hidden to the side that drops you down a staircase to a cellar dwelling.

Met up with some family friends for dinner who recommended this place; we were shown to a table deep inside the premises and decided to opt for pies. The meal was good, beer fine (a mixture of Nicholson's own and some other guest beers) and service excellent.  I decided to try a pudding, cheesecake with a generous dollop of cream.

The total bill for 4 people for meals plus plenty of beers came to under £100 - excellent value for what we had. Will definitely return if I'm in the area.
Wonderful place. Fabulous premises, great food and brilliant staff. Couldn't have been better and cannot wait to go there again.

Lovely little hideaway with a great atmosphere and eclectic clientele. A good range of reasonably priced wines and ales to suit any taste. Bar staff are polite and helpful. Wheelchair access through a lift

Always a fun place to dine out. Standard pub F&B. Great atmosphere on Friday night. Very busy. Unusual decor too. Reservations recommended. Private parties can take over a larger than usual space so you've been warned! ;-). Good service and happy waiting staff. Thank you. See you again.

An unusual themed bar with so much potential. Great gin selection but if it isn't on the menu,, they can't do cocktails. Interesting Roman meets Egyptian theme but in need of a clean. Thick dust on the light shade over our table, cobwebs on the curtains. A real shame as it could be a great location.
Great place for Tex-Mex. Ample range of beers. From Mexican to craft.
Great burriotos! No juices though, can't even have an orange juice... only hot drinks, alcohol and unhealthy fizzy drinks.

My favourite taco and burritos' chain in Madrid. Food is really tasty, it looks way cleaner than other similar chains and it's not crowded. The prices are pretty decent too.

A perfect place to enjoy a good burrito in downtown. Looking forward to come back!
okay tacos, bad flavoured tortilla
They try to be Tierra, but they are more expensive, and their burritos are smaller
Not bad, very local crowd, the tapas are good, and the desserts are nice. A good place to spend a Saturday evening
Great food and service. Kitchen is open quite early for Madrid. I ordered some tapas that are quite traditional. Spanish omelette was very good and so was the squid in its own ink with rice.

Amazing “tapas” and “pinchos” place! Everything I tasted was amazing! The place could be either for family mood, friends or after work! Service is good. And the place its well decorated. It has a terrace were people who smoked can go. Beer okey (Mahou) prices are okey. 20-30€ per person.

Very busy & chaotic place. Tapas are ok but nothing amaizing. For the amount of people service was good in the bar area. I will suggest it for a quick drink&taps but not for a dinner (there are better options in the are).
Lovely place. A local favorite!
Cute little meeting spot. Small but vibrant. Great sauteed shrimp and drinks. Bring your wallet it's not inexpensive. Still a worthy stop.
Tiny menu focussed on seafood. Loved the garlic shrimps here. One of the best I have had in Spain. Not very cheap but well worth it in my opinion.
A world famous place, delicious food, great service. Prices are expensive if you want to come often though...
Superb garlic prawns! A table in the sun with a serve of prawns and a glass of wine is the perfect way to pass a couple of afternoon hours.
The prawns are delicious but I took 1 star off due to the high prices
Excelente

Situado en una estupenda zona de Madrid, tanto para ir con amigos como para ir con visitas. El ambiente es muy distendido y el tipo de público es variado desde gente joven entre 25-30 años hasta gente más bien adulta. Es perfecto para tomar tus cañitas y no perderse su sangría. Las tapas están muy bien. Os lo recomiendo para ir cualquier día.

El precio está bastante ajustado, todo hay que decirlo, pero la comida deja bastante que desear. Por otro lado tenemos la bebida que la tienes servida a tu gusto. En cuanto a la decoración y trato al cliente no es lo mejor del mundo, pero bueno, tampoco es horrible. En definitiva, si te ves apurado, sabes que comer, comes, pero no es de lo mejor. Un 5 sobre 10.

Este establecimiento se caracteriza por su buen servicio, la gente que acude es muy buena y agradable. La decoración es buena y los productos son excelentes. El servicoo podría mejorarse un poco más para que se atienda de forma más rápida y completa a los clientes.

A pesar de tener todos los elementos necesarios para ser un local de éxito, parece que los dueños de La Zapatería han preferido aprovechar su ubicación para sacarle el dinero a los extranjeros y gentes que estén de paso por la zona.

Las tostas, su gran reclamo, son pequeñas y sus ingredientes tienen la calidad justa para degustarlas.

Pero lo peor es la cerveza, ya que sus barriles no pasan la manutención adecuada y eso hace que la bebida sea rancia y vomitiva. Una pena de lugar...

We had one of our receptions for our wedding on the roof terrace. Not only was the cake they made for us simply delicious, but all the staff were truly wonderful. We had a great time, all our guests did too.

Worth the trip up! Cover charge includes a free drink. Great views! Great bartenders will make your choice - curveballs included...😊22-40 will have a great time! 40+ can spend more and have a better time... Groups of singles or couples....
Can’t confirm any of the negative statements. Personnel is young and courteous. Good drinks. Prices are quite high. As expected. Definitely check for yourselves.
Expensive but worth it if you wanted to hang with beautiful people. Good music and dtinks. Great views. Gets crowded. Really worth the experience. Enjoy

This is one secret gem of Madrid! If you aren't staying at the hotel it sits above, I still recommend visiting for the night life and the destinations there after. Semi dress casual cool, ladies dress beautiful as ever, so anticipate beautiful people. The staff are exquisite and amazing with the spice of top notch. Be ready to enjoy yourself.
Booked for a table of 20 for a hen do. The food was amazing!! And the service was great too. Highly recommended. Email contact was prompt to sort details. Thanks
Good food and a great cooking experience as they cook in front of you. Quite exhilarating.
Awesome food, good fun if you have teppanyaki. Great service, reasonably priced too. I'm definitely going back next time I'm in Chester!
Very yummy menu, good quality and not too expensive. Good vibe and attentive waiting staff.
Excellent and authentic food! Nice ambience and good staff. Would highly recommend.

We had one of our receptions for our wedding on the roof terrace. Not only was the cake they made for us simply delicious, but all the staff were truly wonderful. We had a great time, all our guests did too.

Worth the trip up! Cover charge includes a free drink. Great views! Great bartenders will make your choice - curveballs included...😊22-40 will have a great time! 40+ can spend more and have a better time... Groups of singles or couples....
Can’t confirm any of the negative statements. Personnel is young and courteous. Good drinks. Prices are quite high. As expected. Definitely check for yourselves.
Expensive but worth it if you wanted to hang with beautiful people. Good music and dtinks. Great views. Gets crowded. Really worth the experience. Enjoy

This is one secret gem of Madrid! If you aren't staying at the hotel it sits above, I still recommend visiting for the night life and the destinations there after. Semi dress casual cool, ladies dress beautiful as ever, so anticipate beautiful people. The staff are exquisite and amazing with the spice of top notch. Be ready to enjoy yourself.

3.5 stars.  Service was pretty good, I thought it was a bit cheeky that the server didn't bring back change and assumed my American accent inferred tip but I just wanted to go to bed.  Food was good, the portions were okay but my wife's portion was saltier than my plate even though it was from the same pan of paella, but not inedible.  We weren't terribly hungry so no starters just wine and paella.  I don't think it's a place I would seek out, but if you're in the area and looking for paella then it fits the bill.  You still need to book ahead though, even on a Sunday night no walk-ins available until 10PM.

Good place.... So  chic with so nice atmosphere . PAELLA was very very good and, last but not least,the dessert was amazing
Very good price point. Recommended
Great atmosphere and good taste of food. The famous paella is delicious but the price on the menu is for 1 person only (19.9 eur)

EXCELLENT paella, service and overall atmosphere. It's a very sincere spot with multiple somewhat cozy nooks and crannies throughout the restaurant that feature traditional, old-world charm. This is an excellent spot to go for great food, high class service while without any air of pretentiousness or trendiness from the staff nor the other customers. I really like that the seating areas have a variety of family-style as well as more private/cozy options too.
Good food, good service, great place to have dinner with friends.   We had three apps, mixed paella and coffee (it was a lot of food to put desert on top of).   Great family run business.
Was invited by company. Special food, quite simple but good. Easy going, good service. Apparently quite well known in Madrid . It was full on a Tuesday evening.

Located on a busy street of eatery..remember to book in advance to get a table as it's super packed and busy starting from 830. Food is great, a well received local dining area with a great take in local food delicacies..def a must try.
Really lovely restaurant, the food is delicious and I believe they have the best jamon I have ever eaten! Very very recommended!

King Juan Carlos' favorite? Clinton's have been here a few times? Never mind that, make sure you have an early reservations - a few days earlier, preferably - and just come and enjoy this amazing restaurant. We were overwhelmed with friendly service, good food and wine - even the house wine was great.
Huevos Rotos is simply simple but terrific
Crazy midday menu. Stark-designed theater is now a chic but affordable restaurant.

el restaurante teatriz es un sitio muy encatador sobretodo si eres amante del teatro. el servicio es atento y muy apasionado. puedes elegir producto de la carta y tambien eligir algo mas de acuerdo con el chef.

La decoración de Teatriz es espectacular. Está ubicado en un antiguo teatro del barrio de Salamanca y conserva algunos elementos del escenario. De la comida destacaría el atún y me gustó mucho el guacamole. El precio ronda los 50€.

Os recomiendo evitar a toda costa los calamares. Presente quejas sobre la escasez del plato principal en cuestión (parecia un plato de picar) y me informaron de que eran conscientes por quejas de otros clientes. Invitamos a tres parejas a cenar, me salió por un pico, tuvieron que compartir platos para quedar satisfechos, les sentó mal la cena a varios comensales.... En resumen fue para mi un desastre de invitación, se lo hice saber al restaurante por teléfono y nunca mas se supo. No lo olvidaré jamás

Mi primera y única visita a Madrid y mi primera cena en la ciudad! Que recuerdos... cuando vuelva a la capital será visita obligada. Un restaurante muy original con una decoración de lo mas moderna. 
Muchos restaurantes deberían tomar ejemplo.
Not as exciting that I hope it would... the ham was good, the artichoke ok... but the octopus was missing some fine touch. No love in the dishes. I will let you decide but I won’t come back

DO NOT go to this restaurant! My friend had lunch at El Telegrafo a couple of months ago and while eating the ceiling fell down on top of her causing serious injuries. The owner and manager of the restaurant took no responsibility for the incident. This is completely unacceptable and reflects how poorly they operate their business.
Amazing seafood. Nice ambience. Good service

The ceiling of the restaurant collapsed over my friends head and face causing severe injuries. It has been over a year and the restaurant is not taking responsibility of the incident. It’s shameful how they have approached the situation and the lack of customer care they are giving my friend. They really should take better care of their installations.

I would never recommend it

I was having lunch on the terrace of the restaurant "El Telegrafo", when the roof of the restaurant unexpectedly fell on the table on which I was sitting ... see attached photos.

The physical damage was very severe and it has been almost 1 year; and
the only response that I have received has been NEGATIVE, on the part of the Oter Group, as of its Insurance to cover any compensation.

It is outrageous that a "restaurant establishment" does not have the infrastructure or can guarantee its consumers any type of security.

More outrageous is that knowing what happened decide to evade responsibility. 

The only compensation was a free meal ... 

I would never recommend it
